## What is Political Ecology?

"Political ecology is the study of the relationships between political, economic and social factors with environmental issues and changes. Political ecology differs from apolitical ecological studies by politicizing environmental issues and phenomena."

:::{.footer}
[Political Ecology in Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_ecology#:~:text=Political%20ecology%20is%20the%20study%20of%20the%20relationships%20between%20political%2C%20economic%20and%20social%20factors%20with%20environmental%20issues%20and%20changes.%20Political%20ecology%20differs%20from%20apolitical%20ecological%20studies%20by%20politicizing%20environmental%20issues%20and%20phenomena.)
:::

## Core principles
- Societal shares are not equal
- Environment and socio-economic structures are interlinked
- Power imbalances drive problems and [solutions]{style="color: red;"}

### Biodiversity Hostspots

## [Hotspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodiversity_hotspot) in numbers

:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/12/07/obituaries/07Myers1/07Myers1-superJumbo.jpg?quality=75&auto=webp){width=400}

:::
:::{.column width="50%}

- [Norman Myers](https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/oct/31/norman-myers-obituary)
- 1500+ endemic vascular plants
- Lost > 70% of its original area

- Nearly half of Earth's biodiversity

## Strenghts of BH
:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://www.frontiersin.org/files/Articles/410098/frym-07-00029-HTML-r1/image_m/figure-2.jpg)

## Weakenesses of the BH

:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://p2.trrsf.com/image/fget/cf/774/0/images.terra.com/2022/04/18/1887215417-124185110dae1fb6a-30b4-4287-bfa7-291764b6a453.jpg){width=500}

:::
:::{.column width="50%}

### Healf-earth theory

## E.O. Wilson
:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/9/9b/Half-Earth.jpg){width=400}
:::
:::{.column width="50%}

- 50% of Earth for non-human species
- Technological solutions
- The population "bomb"

## Strenghts of the Half-Earth
:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:640/format:webp/1*alao4AZjR95lohA7iiiG-A.png)

:::

- Moral imperative (nature urgency)

- Has evolved since launched
- Politically influential
:::
:::

## Weakenesses of the Half-Earth

:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://climateandcapitalism.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Half-Earth.jpg){width=500}

:::
:::{.column width="50%}

- Top-down

### Convivial Conservation

##
<iframe width="991" height="645" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/AIHRdJmURdc" title="The Case for Convivial Conservation" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

## Strengths of Convivial Conservation
:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

- Very political (takes sides)
- Avoid dichotomies (e.g. Human x Nature)
- Economic basis (rather socialist)
- Bottom-up

:::
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://www.versobooks.com/cdn/shop/products/getimage_516fe355-0460-43e5-ae56-5c051fe76cb8.jpg?v=1682050170&width=287)

:::
:::

## Weakenesses of Convivial Conservation
:::columns
:::{.column width="50%}

- Big changes needed
- Needs more social penetration
- Political side
- Bottom-up (can be a weakeness, too)

:::
:::{.column width="50%}

![](https://media.nature.com/lw767/magazine-assets/d41586-019-03047-9/d41586-019-03047-9_17258906.jpg?as=webp)

:::
